Event handler which extracts asset info from articles or dynamic fields, attempts to find assets in order to automatically append them to a ticket dynamic field. If "FirstArticleOnly" is active (1), only the first article of the ticket is evaluated. "DynamicFieldName" specifies to which dynamic field (of type AssetReference) found assets are appended. Use TicketAutoLinkConfigItem::CISearchPattern, TicketAutoLinkConfigItem::CISearchInClassesPerRecipient and TicketAutoLinkConfigItem::CISearchInClasses for more configuration. Ticket TicketAutoLinkConfigItem
Kernel::System::Ticket::Event::TicketAutoLinkConfigItem
(ArticleCreate|TicketDynamicFieldUpdate_SysMonXHost|TicketDynamicFieldUpdate_SysMonXAlias|TicketDynamicFieldUpdate_SysMonXAddress)
1
AffectedAsset
Defines asset search pattern which is extracted from the ticket. Each regexp needs to return the search value in the first capture group - or the entire pattern. In ArticleCreate-Events only keys named like Article_* are considered (e.g. Article_Body), while dynamic field values are only considered in DF-Update events. However, you may define more than one dynamic field for a regexp-match. In this case the different results are considered as different CI-searches, thus implementing some sort of OR (disjunction). If you want to use more than one regexp on a attribute just add a similar named key with the suffix _OR123 (see defaults). Framework TicketAutoLinkConfigItem
\s*Address:\s+(\d+\.\d+\.\d+\.\d+)\s*
\s*Host:\s+(.+)\s*
(^.+)
(^.+)
(^\d+\.\d+\.\d+\.\d+)
If the triggering articles to-address is defined as key, only those asset classes mentioned in value will be searched. Multiple asset classes must be separated by comma. Framework TicketAutoLinkConfigItem

Kernel::System::ImportExport::ObjectBackend::ITSMConfigItem
Config Item
Sets the configuration level of the administrator. Depending on the config level, some sysconfig options will be not shown. The config levels are in in ascending order: Expert, Advanced, Beginner. The higher the config level is (e.g. Beginner is the highest), the less likely is it that the user can accidentally configure the system in a way that it is not usable any more. Framework Core
100 (Expert)
200 (Advanced)
300 (Beginner)
Controls if the admin is allowed to import a saved system configuration in SysConfig. Framework Core
No
Yes
Defines the name of the application, shown in the web interface, tabs and title bar of the web browser. Framework Core
KIX
Defines the system identifier. Every ticket number and http session string contains this ID. This ensures that only tickets which belong to your system will be processed as follow-ups (useful when communicating between two instances of KIX). Framework Core
10
Defines the fully qualified domain names of the system. This setting is used as a variable, "<KIX_CONFIG_FQDN>" (refers to "Frontend" value) which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, e.g. to build links to the tickets within your system. Framework Core
your-frontend-host.example.com
your-backend-host.example.com
your-ssp-host.example.com
Defines the cluster node identifier. This is only used in cluster configurations where there is more than one KIX frontend system. Note: only values from 1 to 99 are allowed. Framework Core
1
Defines the type of protocol, used by the web server, to serve the application. If https protocol will be used instead of plain http, it must be specified here. Since this has no affect on the web server's settings or behavior, it will not change the method of access to the application and, if it is wrong, it will not prevent you from logging into the application. This setting is only used as a variable, KIX_CONFIG_HttpType which is found in all forms of messaging used by the application, to build links to the tickets within your system. Framework Core
http
https
Defines the system administrator's email address. It will be displayed in the error screens of the application. Framework Core
admin@example.com
Company name which will be included in outgoing emails as an X-Header. Framework Core
Defines the default front-end language. All the possible values are determined by the available language files on the system (see the next setting). Framework Core
de
Defines all the languages that are available to the application. Specify only English names of languages here. Framework Core
German
English
Uses richtext for viewing and editing: articles, salutations, signatures, standard templates, auto responses and notifications. Framework Core::Web
No
Yes
Defines the default CSS used in rich text editors. Framework Core::Web
[{"Selector": ".cke_editable", "Value": "font-family:Geneva,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 12px;"}]
Disable HTTP header "X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN" to allow KIX to be included as an IFrame in other websites. Disabling this HTTP header can be a security issue! Only disable it, if you know what you are doing! Framework Core::Web
No
Yes
Disable HTTP header "Content-Security-Policy" to allow loading of external script contents. Disabling this HTTP header can be a security issue! Only disable it, if you know what you are doing! Framework Core::Web
No
Yes
Defines the date input format used in forms (option or input fields). Framework Core::Time
Option
Input
Allows choosing between showing the attachments of a ticket in the browser (inline) or just make them downloadable (attachment). Framework Core::Web
inline
attachment
Makes the application check the MX record of email addresses before sending an email or submitting a telephone or email ticket. Framework Core
No
Yes
Defines the address of a dedicated DNS server, if necessary, for the "CheckMXRecord" look-ups. Framework Core
ns.example.com
Makes the application check the syntax of email addresses. Framework Core
No
Yes
Defines a regular expression that excludes some addresses from the syntax check (if "CheckEmailAddresses" is set to "Yes"). Please enter a regex in this field for email addresses, that aren't syntactically valid, but are necessary for the system (i.e. "root@localhost"). Framework Core
^(kix@localhost|admin@localhost)$
Defines a regular expression that filters all email addresses that should not be used in the application. Framework Core
@(example)\.(..|...)$
Defines a regular expression that filters all email addresses that should not receive emails from the application. Framework Core
noreply-.*?@nomail\.com
Defines the link type 'Normal'. If the source name and the target name contain the same value, the resulting link is a non-directional one; otherwise, the result is a directional link. Framework Core::LinkObject
Normal
Normal
Defines the link type 'ParentChild'. If the source name and the target name contain the same value, the resulting link is a non-directional one; otherwise, the result is a directional link. Framework Core::LinkObject
Parent
Child
Defines the link type groups. The link types of the same group cancel one another. Example: If ticket A is linked per a 'Normal' link with ticket B, then these tickets could not be additionally linked with link of a 'ParentChild' relationship. Framework Core::LinkObject
Normal
ParentChild
Defines the log module for the system. "File" writes all messages in a given logfile, "SysLog" uses the syslog daemon of the system, e.g. syslogd. Framework Core::Log
If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, a special log facility can be specified. Framework Core::Log
user
If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, a special log sock can be specified (on solaris you may need to use 'stream'). Framework Core::Log
unix
If "SysLog" was selected for LogModule, the charset that should be used for logging can be specified. Framework Core::Log
iso-8859-1
iso-8859-15
utf-8
If "file" was selected for LogModule, a logfile must be specified. If the file doesn't exist, it will be created by the system. Framework Core::Log
<KIX_CONFIG_Home>/var/log/kix.log
If "file" was selected for LogModule, rotate the log files never, hourly, daily, weekly or monthly. The default is monthly. Framework Core::Log
Never
Hourly
Daily
Weekly
Monthly
If "file" was selected for LogModule, create a new log file if the maximum size has been reached. You can enter bytes or add "K" (kilobytes) or "M" (megabytes) or "G" (gigabytes) to make it easier. Set it to 0 (default) if no maximum size exists. PLEASE NOTE: the maximum size of the file will not exactly match, due to the different length of the log messages. Framework Core::Log
0
If "file" was selected for LogModule, keep this number of old files. Set it to 0 if no files should be deleted. Framework Core::Log
12
Set minimum loglevel. If you select 'error', just errors are logged. With 'debug' you get all logging messages. Framework Core::Log
error
notice
info
debug
Defines the module to send emails. "Sendmail" directly uses the sendmail binary of your operating system. Any of the "SMTP" mechanisms use a specified (external) mailserver. "DoNotSendEmail" doesn't send emails and it is useful for test systems. Framework Core::Sendmail
If "Sendmail" was selected as SendmailModule, the location of the sendmail binary and the needed options must be specified. Framework Core::Sendmail
/usr/sbin/sendmail -i -f
If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, the mailhost that sends out the mails must be specified. Framework Core::Sendmail
mail.example.com
If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, the port where your mailserver is listening for incoming connections must be specified. Framework Core::Sendmail
25
If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, and authentication to the mail server is needed, an username must be specified. Framework Core::Sendmail
MailserverLogin
If any of the "SMTP" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, and authentication to the mail server is needed, a password must be specified. Framework Core::Sendmail
MailserverPassword
If any of the "OAuth2" mechanisms was selected as SendmailModule, the profile to use for OAuth2 must be specified. Framework Core::Sendmail
Profile1
Sends all outgoing email via bcc to the specified address. Please use this only for backup reasons. Framework Core::Sendmail
If set, this address is used as envelope sender in outgoing messages (not notifications - see below). If no address is specified, the envelope sender is equal to queue e-mail address. Framework Core::Sendmail
If set, this address is used as envelope sender header in outgoing notifications. If no address is specified, the envelope sender header is empty. Framework Core::Sendmail
If no SendmailNotificationEnvelopeFrom is specified, this setting makes it possible to use the email's from address instead of an empty envelope sender (required in certain mail server configurations). Framework Core::Sendmail
No
Yes
Forces encoding of outgoing emails (7bit|8bit|quoted-printable|base64). Framework Core::Sendmail
base64
How to handle embedded images in email body. Framework Core::Sendmail
CID
Inline

Key: Day of Week (Mon|Tue|Wed|Thu|Fri|Sat|Sun) or Text of Vacation Day Value: HH:MM-HH:MM[,HH:MM-HH:MM] Notes: - Used key for workingtime is choosen in following order: TimeVacationDaysOneTime > TimeVacationDays > Day of Week If it is a vacation day and there is no entry for its key, there is no working time for this day - If there is no valid definition, or config deactivated, default function of KIX is used. Defines days and times of the indicated calendar, to count as working time. Key: Day of Week (Mon|Tue|Wed|Thu|Fri|Sat|Sun) or Text of Vacation Day Value: HH:MM-HH:MM[,HH:MM-HH:MM] Notes: - Used key for workingtime is choosen in following order: TimeVacationDaysOneTime > TimeVacationDays > Day of Week If it is a vacation day and there is no entry for its key, there is no working time for this day - If there is no valid definition, or config deactivated, default function of KIX is used. Key: Day of Week (Mon|Tue|Wed|Thu|Fri|Sat|Sun) or Text of Vacation Day Value: HH:MM-HH:MM[,HH:MM-HH:MM] Notes: - Used key for workingtime is choosen in following order: TimeVacationDaysOneTime > TimeVacationDays > Day of Week If it is a vacation day and there is no entry for its key, there is no working time for this day - If there is no valid definition, or config deactivated, default function of KIX is used. Dis-/Enables uniqueness check for email-addresses of contacts. If this setting is disabled, notifications may be read by contacts who are not supposed to receive personal information about the actual contact. This may cause a violation of GDPR regulation! Thus, you have to ensure that no notification contains relevant information. Furthermore, any email-based contact retrieval or identification may potentially deliver ambiguous results. Incoming emails are assigned to the first contact ordered by last name, first name assigned to the email-address. Some features like e-mail based authentication, email-based contact data update from LDAP or macro action CreateOrUpdateContact will be disabled if no other lookup value than email is provided. Once disabled you MUST NOT enable it again before ensuring unique email addresses. Framework Contact
